channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: An Important Message from the Administration Division Regarding Summer Temperatures
item.description: Due to the extreme summer heat, Physical Plant is asking the campus community to take as many additional measures as possible to conserve energy and reduce cooling and electrical demand through Friday, June 21.
item.author: Community

item.title: Pride Day at Troy Farmers Market Scheduled for June 22
item.description: Date: Saturday, June 22, 2024 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM - Wear and show off your Pride colors, stop by the Pride center table and receive a prize and a raffle opportunity! The event will feature great local food and goods, music, and entertainment, so come visit the downtown Troy businesses, many of whom are proud members of the LGBTQ community or ally businesses.
item.author: Community

item.title: Appointments Now Available at COMM+D!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re still in the initial brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design can help, so schedule an appointment with a member of COMM+D’s trained staff today!
item.author: Students

item.title: Registration Now Open for NSF GRFP Bootcamp
item.description: Date: Wednesday, June 5, 2024 8:00 AM - First-year graduate students, juniors and seniors are encouraged to register for this virtual program to develop strong applications to the National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship Program, which begins June 24 and provides three years of salary and tuition while students earn their graduate degree. U.S. citizenship or permanent residency is required.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Schedules Mechanical Engineering Review
item.description: Date: Wednesday, June 26, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work faculty as they cover Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Experienced engineers are asked to take on larger and more complex tasks as they progress in their careers, and this program provides the necessary breadth and depth, no matter where one’s career takes them. Please register if you would like to attend.
item.author: Students

item.title: Faculty Training, “Using Handshake for Undergraduate Research Postings,” to be Held June 25
item.description: On Tuesday, June 25 from noon to 1:30pm, the CCPD will host an interactive opportunity for faculty members to learn how to use Handshake for posting undergraduate research positions. At the end of the training, attendees will know more about Handshake, have an employer profile set up, and be prepared to post their first job. Space is limited to 15 participants; interested faculty should email Nicole Doran to sign up. Lunch will be provided.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Proposal Preparation Workshop Slated for June 25
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, June 25, 2024 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Hosted by the Office for Research, Research Administration & Finance, and Office of the General Counsel, this workshop provides an overview of RPI tools for proposal preparation and submission, as well as new NSF guidelines and requirements. Although aimed at PIs with limited/no proposal experience at RPI, the event is open to all; presentations will broadly apply across all federal agency submissions but will emphasize NSF requirements.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
